intro: Adnaria decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive adnaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Adnaria decipiens is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
